title: Westrock Coffee to Go Public in $1.2 Billion SPAC Deal
sub_head: The Arkansas-based company is merging with Riverview Acquisition and raising a $250 million PIPE
body:
Westrock Coffee Holdings LLC is combining with a special-purpose acquisition company to go public with a valuation of roughly $1.2 billion, company officials said.
North Little Rock, Ark.-based Westrock sits in the middle of the supply chains for coffee, tea and other beverage ingredients, working with small-scale farmers around the world to eventually provide products for restaurants and brands such as Walmart Inc. and McDonaldâ€™s Corp. It says its operations account for more than 20 million cups of coffee daily from sustainable, digitally traceable supply chains.
